name: Ca' Alexander

reviews.text: My mother and I spent two nights in the Ca' Alexander. Once we got over getting our massive luggage up the 72 stairs, yes, 72 stairs, we had a really enjoyable stay here. The room itself is huge! The decor is great and the view of the street below is phenomenal. The breakfast consisted of brioche (hot fruit filled croissants) and rolls, along with coffee, juice and yoghurt. They also left out great chocolates for us.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!!
Ca' Alexander: a Treat!
reviews.text: This pensione is easy to get to (once you know where it is) via the Vaporetti (Water Bus). You get off at "Arsenale", then turn right and walk up to Via Garabaldi. Turn left down Garabaldi and walk down the street about 400metres. The small alley that you need to take is on the left hand side of the street. Once you walk down it....the door for the hotel is on left. You need to read the knocker to see that you are there. There are NO signs guiding your way. If you have trouble, ask one of the owners of the restauarants on Garabaldi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only draw back to this suite, was the miniscule shower. It was incredibly awkward, but, not a reason to not stay here.
reviews.title: "A Venetian Palace ..."

likes.liked: — Everything, value for money, quality fittings and fixtures, locaton, sunnt terrace

reviews.title: THE place to stay
reviews.text: I would definitely not recommend this pensione for seniors, disable tourists or anyone with mobility issues.

description: Ca' Alexander B&B is a beautiful attic with terrace located in Castello district, facing the picturesque main road Via Garibaldi, near the famous Biennale Exhibitions of Art and the Arsenale.The attic at the top of a Venetian building (4°floor/ no lift) consists of a big double-room with a single bed, kitchen and table for breakfast,a living-room with another bed,a nice bathroom with shower and an amazing terrace.
